{"step_by_step_thinking": "Type-IV isthmii refers to the type of canal configuration in a tooth. It is not about complete communication between two canals, which is Type-II, nor about no communication between any canal, which is Type-I. It is also not about complete or incomplete isthmus between three or more canals. Type-IV isthmii is characterized by two or three canal openings without visible connections.", "answer_choice": "D"}
